definition: to drape over one's shoulders/to open/to unroll/to split open/to spread out

sentences.english: His attendants pretended to pick up the long train at the back of his cloak.
sentences.chinese: 侍從們假裝拾起皇帝披風后那長長的後裾。

sentences.english: Schistosomes also possess what seems to be a cloak of invisibility: an unusual covering known as the tegument .
sentences.chinese: 血吸蟲還有一種如同隱形披風的特殊外衣，稱爲體壁。

sentences.english: You can only embroider your own cloak and embroidering your cloak will cause it to become soulbound.
sentences.chinese: 你只能在自己的披風上刺繡，而且刺繡後披風將綁定。

sentences.english: You can only embroider your own cloak and embroidering your cloak will cause it to become soulbound.
sentences.chinese: 你只能在自己的披風上刺繡，而且刺繡後披風將綁定。

sentences.english: His figure was enveloped in a riding cloak, fur collared and steel clasped;
sentences.chinese: 他身上裹着騎手披風，戴着皮毛領，繫着鋼釦子。

sentences.english: Gold wall fabric inlays are on each side of the mantle over mahogany bookshelves.
sentences.chinese: 金牆壁織品鑲嵌細工在披風的每邊在桃花心木書架的。

sentences.english: They also have a specialized siphon jet under its mantle, that expels water and propels them as well.
sentences.chinese: 披風狀的身體下方還有特別的虹管，也可噴水助遊。

sentences.english: Hair streaming in the wind, cloak ballooning behind her like a sheet anchor, she let the two?
sentences.chinese: 她的頭髮隨風飛舞，披風在身後飄揚。

sentences.english: So the chances of new and interesting things happening with cloaks are high.
sentences.chinese: 所以即使單單披風也會有很多有意思和新的東西。

sentences.english: In a blue frock-coat buttoned up close decorated with the legion of honor.
sentences.chinese: 穿一件藍色的披風，排胸扣的，還掛着榮譽勳章。

sentences.english: Come and sit with me here on the sledge and I will put my mantle round you and we will talk.
sentences.chinese: 坐到我雪橇上來吧，我給你裹上披風，好一起談談心。

sentences.english: His cape was made of the finest gold woven into tiny little leaves.
sentences.chinese: 他的披風是最上等的黃金打造的，由細小的金葉組成。

sentences.english: Wonderful gerben want to cloak back to cloud crazy, but found that broke a hole.
sentences.chinese: 妙戈想把披風還給雲狂，卻發現破了一個洞。

sentences.english: And shorter hem lines apply to coats& capes as well.
sentences.chinese: 越來越短的衣服邊也應用到了外衣和披風上。

sentences.english: The ponchos are indicative of the miserable weather the soldiers faced.
sentences.chinese: 穿着的披風表明了戰士們所面對的惡劣天氣。

sentences.english: She was cloaked in red wool.

definition: (old) combat robe/soldier's uniform/(sports) team jersey/team shirt
crew neck/round neck (of pull-over garment, e.g. T-shirt)
